interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Sharknado Triple Feature (Sharknado / The Second One / Oh Hell No!)
Review Date: 2017/04/19
Store: Ian Ziering  (Actor),     Tara Reid  (Actor),     Anthony C. Ferrante  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Fantasy
Product Description: ['SharknadoWhen a freak hurricane swamps Los Angeles, thousands of sharks terrorize the waterlogged populace, and nature s deadliest killer rules sea, land, and air.Special Features: The Making of Sharknado, Cast & Crew Commentary, Gag Reel & TrailersSharknado 2: The Second OneWhen a Category 7 hurricane pummels New York, the surging flood waters bring thousands of sharks. To make matters worse, tornadoes soon dot the horizon, As Sharknadoes tear through the city, no vehicle, building, or national monument is safe. Special Features: The Making of Sharknado 2, Shark Chum: From the Cutting Room Floor, Gag Reel, Cameos: I can t Believe They Got..., Director s Commentary with Ian Ziering and Tara Reid & TrailersSharknado 3: Oh Hell No!When a mass of Sharknadoes threatens America s East Coast, chainsaw-wielding hero Fin must again risk his life to save his children on spring break. But as he fights his way south, the sharknadoes merge and grow bigger.Special Features: The Making of Sharknado 3, The Evolution of Sharknado VFX, VFX Before and After, Gag Reel & many more!']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Horror/Things That Go Bump/Monsters, Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Anthony C. Ferrante, Ian Ziering, Vivica A. Review Text: These movies will never be Oscar worthy, but they crack me up.
Review Title: Hilarious

reference_summary:
The Day After [DVD]
Jason Robards  (Actor),     JoBeth Williams  (Actor),     Nicholas Meyer  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
['The countdown has begun! Against the real-life backdrop of the U.S. deployment of WMDs in Europe during the escalating Cold War, this "dramatically involving [and] agonizingly graphic film" (The Hollywood Reporter) about nuclear holocaust detonated a direct hit into the heartland of America.Starring Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steven Guttenberg, John Cullum and John Lithgow, this "controversial, potent drama" (Leonard Maltin) remains "one of the most talked-about programs in history"(Newsweek)! When Cold War tensions reach the ultimate boiling point, the inhabitants of a small town in Kansas learn along with the rest of America that they have fewer than 30 minutes before 300 Soviet warheads begin to appear overhead! Can anyone survive this ultimate nightmare...or the nuclear winter that is sure to follow?']
{'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Steve Guttenberg, Amy Madigan, JoBeth Williams, Georgann Johnson, John Lithgow, Jason Robards, Edward Hume, Bibi Besch, Jeff East, Calvin Jung, Lori Lethin, Nicholas Meyer, William Allen Young, John CullumSteve Guttenberg, Amy Madigan, JoBeth Williams, Georgann Johnson, John Lithgow, Jason Robards, Edward Hume, Bibi Besch, Jeff East, Calvin Jung, Lori Lethin, Nicholas Meyer, William Allen Young, John Cullum   See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Nicholas Meyer', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 18, 2004', 'Actors': 'Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steve Guttenberg, John Cullum, John Lithgow', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Edward Hume', 'Number of discs': '1'}
I was a teenager when this came out. My folks let me stay up to watch it. Scared the crap out of me. Nuclear War was my boogie man, it kept me up at night.
Scared the crap out of me.

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest Area:** Movies, particularly dramatic narratives focused on historical or intense themes, but also enjoys humorous and campy films with unique concepts.
- **Key Themes:** Nuclear war, Cold War tensions, survival scenarios, and light-hearted horror/comedy.
- **Emotional Engagement:** Strong emotional response to narratives involving fear and existential threats, but also appreciates comedic relief in absurd situations.
- **Content Format Preference:** Prefers DVDs and classic media formats, showing an openness to more unconventional and genre-bending films.
- **Ratings Tendencies:** Values impactful storytelling, reflected in high ratings for emotional resonance and comedic enjoyment, indicating a flexible rating scale based on narrative approach.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Personal connections to content from youth influence preferences, hinting at a playful engagement with nostalgic comedies alongside serious dramas.
- **Genre Affinity:** Drama and action-adventure, especially those that tackle serious societal issues, mixed with an enjoyment of horror and fantasy elements that offer entertainment and humor.

This user appreciates films that evoke strong feelings, particularly fear related to real-world issues, while also finding enjoyment in absurd narratives that provide levity, reflecting a diverse viewing taste that balances intensity with humor.
